At 01:12 AM 06/10/01, you wrote:
>I think it would add a lot of value.  And cooperating to do the 
>translations makes sense (speaking unofficially).
>- Tod
>
>Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
>
> > > Has anyone translated the strings in JUnit?  What was involved?
> >
> > I don't think that it was done and I was wondering if an 
> internationalized JUnit can add much value.  A nice to have but certainly 
> not a top priority.


I'd be inclined to agree with Vladimir - I don't think that there are 
really enough messages within JUnit to make it that useful. (Not to mention 
that to program in java you need to know a certain amount of English anyway 
- all the JFCs have English names...) Of course, documentation is another 
matter...  Or is that what you are referring to?



Jim
